byline.original: By J.W. KERNICK Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Premier Saydam explains emergency law and financial situation
snippet: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Feb. 29-- Premier Refik Saydam, speaking to the Turkish people tonight over the radio, declared that there had been no change in Soviet-Turkish relations in the last six months....

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICA AND NEAR EAST AREAS

headline.main: TURKISH FRIENDSHIP WITH SOVIET CITED; Ankara Premier Asserts There Has Been No Change in the Relations of 2 States ASSAILS FOREIGN RUMORS Saydam Says Country Will Not Enter the War Unless Its Interests Are Threatened

lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Feb. 29-- Premier Refik Saydam, speaking to the Turkish people tonight over the radio, declared that there had been no change in Soviet-Turkish relations in the last six months.
